column2: Variable Label/Description
Age (years)
Completed secondary school education or higher
Ability to read Kiswahili or English without difficulty
Married or living together
Size of household
Landowner
Access to an improved source of drinking water (e.g., piped water)

Time to travel from home to health facility (minutes)
Worked for pay in last week
Easy access to KES 2,000 if treatment for illness needed in household

Frequent/daily use of mobile phone to send text messages

# Prenatal care visits for current pregnancy

# Total pregnancies, including current pregnancy

PHQ-2 score
Eligible but did not complete antenatal follow-up survey
Eligible but did not complete postpartum follow-up survey
Knowledge summary index
# Signs of labor listed without prompting
Share of antenatal danger sign knowledge questions correctly answered
Share of postpartum danger sign knowledge questions correctly answered
Share of neonatal danger sign knowledge questions correctly answered
Birth preparedness summary index
Total # items done in preparation for childbirth
Mother had plan to breastfeed within one hour of childbirth
Late arrival at facility for childbirth

Total # ANC visits attended
At least one PNC visit attended by mother within six weeks of childbirth during which own health was discussed
Received at least the national-guideline-recommended # ANC visits
Received at least the national-guideline-recommended # PNC visits
Childbirth occurred in hospital or other formal health center
Medical advice or treatment sought during prior month of pregnancy
Medical advice or treatment sought for mother’s health postpartum
Medical advice or treatment sought for newborn’s health postpartum
Danger sign care seeking summary index
Medical care sought for mother in response to at least 1 antenatal danger sign
Medical care sought for mother in response to at least 1 postpartum danger sign
Medical care sought for newborn in response to at least 1 neonatal danger sign
Newborn care summary index
Newborn exclusively breastfed by mother
Newborn always put to sleep through the night on their back
Newborn sung/talked to by mother many times over past 24 hours
Postpartum care content summary index
Mother’s health discussed with a provider during at least one PNC visit
Provider conducted physical exam for mother during at least one PNC visit
Provider discussed family planning with mother during at least one PNC visit
Provider offered mother cervical cancer screening during at least one PNC visit
Provider conducted physical exam for newborn during at least one PNC visit
Provider provided immunization for newborn during at least one PNC visit
Share of antenatal, postpartum, and neonatal danger sign knowledge questions correctly answered
Medical care sought in response to at least 1 antenatal, postpartum, or neonatal danger sign
Receipt of respectful maternity care during last ANC visit
Receipt of respectful care during childbirth
Self-efficacy in care seeking (i.e., participant felt empowered to ask providers any questions) during last ANC visit
Self-efficacy in care seeking (i.e., participant felt empowered to ask providers any questions) during pregnancy and childbirth
Use of prenatal supplements containing iron and folic acid during pregnancy
